Ordinary people are attached to the view of permanence regarding phenomena. The phenomena they are attached to eventually return to impermanence, and sentient beings experience sorrow, lamentation, pain, and distress. Therefore, the Buddha said:

Just as there are two kinds of impermanence:

Because of attaining this acceptance of non-arising, one then enters the stage of the bodhisattva;

The evil paths refer to the three evil destinies;

Humans, gods, and asuras.
